creditline: Gift of Richard L. Simmons in memory of Roberta Grodberg Simmons
dimension:
108 1/4 x 31 1/2 in. (274.89 x 80.01 cm)
1 1/2 in. (3.81 cm) (object part, length, fringe, both ends)
medium: Wool, cotton, mirrors, embroidery, block print
object_name: Woman's wedding veil (Phulakiya ludaki), Woman's Wedding/Festival Veil
text:
A Vaghadia Rabari woman customarily wore a plain black woolen veil. But during her marriage ceremonies, she donned a brightly embroidered head covering with nine pillowed medallions arrayed along the center seam. One other Rabari group also embroidered veils with pillowed medallions, but a line of nine meant only Vaghadia Rabari.


Add photograph - Frater, p. 172
title: Woman's wedding veil (Phulakiya ludaki)
